title: The Economics of Digital Addiction
text:
In this project, we review “Digital Addiction” by Allcott et al. from the American Economic Review 2022.
Hunt Allcott, Matthew Gentzkow, and Lena Song. “Digital Addiction.” American Economic Review 2022. Accessed at www.aeaweb.org/articles?id=10.1257/aer.20210867

title: National Hockey League (NHL) Shooting
text:
In this project, we aimed to deepen our understand of the relationships between player performance, strategic decision-making, and environmental factors that influence goal-scoring in hockey. These insights have the potential to inform coaching practices, player development initiatives, decision-making within the sport, ultimately improving the competitiveness and excitement of hockey.
We explored three research questions:

How do NHL teams differ in their ability to convert shots into goals, and how does this variation in goal conversion rates correlate with shot accuracy and effectiveness across different game periods?
How do NHL teams differ in their ability to convert shots into goals, and how does this variation in goal conversion rates correlate with shot accuracy and effectiveness across different game periods?
Is there a “home-rink advantage” between home and away games for NHL teams, and to what extent, if any, does this effect exist?

title: Exploring the Impact of Mental Health Professional Density on Mental Health
text: In this report, done in collaboration with the Summer Undergraduate Research Experience (SURE) program within Carnegie Mellon University’s Statistics & Data Science Department, we explored the catalysts driving the mental health crisis in the United States. Using county-level data from the University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute, we modelled a linear regression to find the variables which most affect mental health across the US.

title: Lay Len Ching
text: I am a Senior at Carnegie Mellon University pursuing a BSc in Behavioral Economics and a BA in Philosophy. My goal is to contribute to meaningful change and reshape industries through evidence-based decision-making.
